input.code:
### Notation

- Scalars: lower-case letters \\(v,m\\)
- Vectors: boldface lower-case letters \\(\mathbf{v}\\)
- Matrices: boldface capital letters \\(\mathbf{M}\\)

TODO: staged?

- \\(i\\)th element of a vector \\(\mathbf{v}\\): \\(v_i\\)
- \\((i,j)\\)-element of a matrix \\(\mathbf{M}\\): \\(m_{ij}\\)
- \\(i\\)th row of a matrix \\(\mathbf{M}\\): \\(\mathbf{m}_{i:}\\)
- \\(j\\)th column of a matrix \\(\mathbf{M}\\): \\(\mathbf{m}_{:j}\\)
input.outputFormat:
Notation

  • Scalars: lower-case letters v,m
  • Vectors: boldface lower-case letters v
  • Matrices: boldface capital letters M

TODO: staged?

  • ith element of a vector v: vi
  • (i,j)-element of a matrix M: mij
  • ith row of a matrix M: vi:
  • jth column of a matrix M: v:j

input.code:
### Matrix Operations
- the **inner product** is \\(<u,v> := \sum_{\\ell=1}^L u_\ell v_\ell\\)
where \\(u\in\Re^L\\) and \\(v\in\Re^L\\)
- the **outer product**  \\( u \otimes v \\) between vectors \\(u\in\Re^n\\) and \\(v\in\Re^m\\) is the \\(n\times m\\) matrix with elements \\(u_iv_j\\), \\( i=\{1,\cdots,n\} \\) and \\(j= \{1,\cdots,n\} \\).
- for matrices \\(\mathbf{U} \in\Re^{n\times L} \\) and \\(\mathbf{V} \in \Re^{L \times m} \\), \\( \mathbf{U} \otimes \mathbf{V} := \sum_{\ell=1}^L \mathbf{U}_{:\ell} \otimes \mathbf{V}_{\ell:} \\)
input.outputFormat:
Matrix Operations

  • the inner product is <u,v>:=∑Lℓ=1uℓvℓ where u∈ℜL and v∈ℜL
  • the outer product u⊗v between vectors u∈ℜn and v∈ℜm is the n×m matrix with elements uivj, i=1,⋯,n and j=1,⋯,n.
  • for matrices U∈ℜn×L and V∈ℜL×m, U⊗V:=∑Lℓ=1U:ℓ⊗Vℓ:

input.code:
### References 
- Kolda, Tamara G., and Brett W. Bader. "Tensor decompositions and applications." SIAM review 51.3 (2009): 455-500.
- Goldberg, Andrew B., Zhu, Xiaojin, Recht, Benjamin, Xu, Jun-Ming, Nowak, Robert. "Transduction with Matrix Completion: Three Birds with One Stone." In Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems (NIPS) 24. 2010. 

Are we going to have these after every section? I was thinking of having another "chapter" in the end, where we annotate them.
